Workplace Culture.description: The gig economy offers flexibility and independence for workers, allowing them to choose their own hours and work on a project basis, but it often lacks job security and benefits.

Workplace Culture.name: Labor Unions
Workplace Culture.description: Labor unions are essential for protecting workers' rights, improving wages, and ensuring safe working conditions by providing collective bargaining power against employers.

Privacy.name: Privacy as a Fundamental Right
Privacy.description: Individuals should have an absolute right to privacy, and governments or corporations should not be able to intrude on personal data or communications without consent.

Privacy.name: Data Transparency
Privacy.description: While privacy is important, transparency of personal data is necessary in certain contexts, such as public safety or legal investigations, to ensure accountability.

Privacy.name: End-to-End Encryption
Privacy.description: All digital communications should be protected by end-to-end encryption, ensuring that only the communicating parties can access the content.

Privacy.name: Anonymity Online
Privacy.description: People should have the right to remain anonymous online, protecting their identity while using the internet for communication, browsing, or transactions.

Privacy.name: Government Surveillance for Security
Privacy.description: Governments should have the ability to monitor communications and data to prevent crime and terrorism, even if it compromises individual privacy.

Privacy.name: Privacy-First Technology
Privacy.description: Technology companies should prioritize user privacy, designing services and devices that minimize data collection and protect user information by default.

Privacy.name: Opt-In Data Sharing
Privacy.description: Users should explicitly consent to any data collection or sharing, with clear and transparent policies explaining how their data is used.

Privacy.name: The Right to Be Forgotten
Privacy.description: Individuals should have the right to request the deletion of their personal data from online platforms, ensuring control over their digital footprint.

Privacy.name: Decentralized Privacy Solutions
Privacy.description: Decentralized technologies should be used to protect privacy, enabling individuals to manage and control their own data without reliance on centralized entities.

Privacy.name: Corporate Data Ownership
Privacy.description: Corporations that collect personal data should retain ownership of that data and be free to use it for commercial purposes.

Freedom of Expression.name: Absolute Freedom of Speech
Freedom of Expression.description: People should have the unrestricted right to express any opinion, no matter how controversial, without censorship or legal repercussions.

Freedom of Expression.name: Limited Free Speech
Freedom of Expression.description: Freedom of speech should have limits, especially when it incites violence, spreads hate, or promotes false information that could harm others.

Freedom of Expression.name: Censorship for Public Safety
Freedom of Expression.description: The government or platforms should censor speech that poses a threat to public safety, such as terrorism or extreme hate speech.

Freedom of Expression.name: Corporate Regulation of Speech
Freedom of Expression.description: Social media platforms and tech companies have the right to regulate content and speech on their platforms, ensuring they comply with community standards.

Freedom of Expression.name: Freedom of the Press
Freedom of Expression.description: The press should be free from government interference and censorship, allowing journalists to report on matters of public interest without fear of retaliation.

Freedom of Expression.name: Net Neutrality
Freedom of Expression.description: Internet service providers should treat all data on the internet equally, without giving priority to certain websites, services, or content, ensuring a free and open internet.

Freedom of Expression.name: Anonymity and Free Speech
Freedom of Expression.description: Individuals should have the right to express opinions anonymously, especially in contexts where revealing their identity could result in personal harm.

Freedom of Expression.name: Free Speech in Academia
Freedom of Expression.description: Academic institutions should protect free speech, allowing for the open exchange of ideas, even those that challenge prevailing norms or are unpopular.

Freedom of Expression.name: Artistic Freedom
Freedom of Expression.description: Artists should have the freedom to express themselves through their art without censorship, even if their work is provocative, controversial, or offensive to some.

Freedom of Expression.name: Political Correctness
Freedom of Expression.description: Speech should be mindful of and sensitive to marginalized groups, and harmful or offensive language should be discouraged to promote inclusivity.

Freedom of Expression.name: Content Moderation by Algorithms
Freedom of Expression.description: Algorithms should be used to monitor and moderate online content, automatically flagging and removing harmful or illegal speech.

Freedom of Expression.name: Free Speech in Protests
Freedom of Expression.description: People should have the right to engage in peaceful protest and demonstrations, expressing dissent or opposition to government policies without fear of repression.

Freedom of Expression.name: Blasphemy and Religious Critique
Freedom of Expression.description: Freedom of expression should include the right to criticize or satirize religious beliefs, even if it offends some members of those religious communities.

Freedom of Expression.name: Free Speech in Digital Spaces
Freedom of Expression.description: Online platforms should protect free expression, ensuring that users can share their ideas and opinions freely without undue censorship or suppression.

Freedom of Expression.name: Safe Spaces and Speech
Freedom of Expression.description: Certain spaces should prioritize emotional and psychological safety over unrestricted speech, limiting potentially harmful discourse.

Freedom of Expression.name: Online Platform Responsibility
Freedom of Expression.description: Platforms should be held accountable for the content they host, taking responsibility for moderating harmful, illegal, or misleading content.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Pro-Choice
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Individuals should have the right to make decisions about abortion, with access to safe and legal abortion services.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Parental Leave Equality
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Both parents should have equal access to paid parental leave, ensuring that caregiving responsibilities are shared and that all parents can bond with their children.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Same-Sex Adoption
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Same-sex couples should have the same rights as heterosexual couples to adopt and raise children, with the best interest of the child being paramount.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Surrogacy
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Individuals should have the right to pursue surrogacy as a means of having children, with clear legal protections for all parties involved.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Child Custody Equality
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: In cases of divorce or separation, custody should be awarded equally between both parents unless there are significant reasons not to, ensuring that children maintain strong relationships with both parents.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Single-Parent Adoption
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Single individuals should have the right to adopt children, with no additional barriers compared to couples.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Parental Consent for Minors' Medical Procedures
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Parents should have the legal right to consent to or veto medical procedures for their children, including reproductive health services.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Adolescent Reproductive Autonomy
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Adolescents should have the right to access reproductive health services, including contraception and abortion, without parental consent.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: No-Fault Divorce
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Couples should be allowed to divorce without proving fault, allowing for the dissolution of marriage without assigning blame.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Marriage Equality
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Marriage should be legally recognized for all couples, regardless of gender or sexual orientation.

Reproductive Rights and Family Law.name: Fertility Treatment
Reproductive Rights and Family Law.description: Individuals and couples should have access to fertility treatments, including in vitro fertilization (IVF).

Cryptocurrency.name: Bitcoin Maximalism
Cryptocurrency.description: Bitcoin is the only cryptocurrency that will succeed in the long term, and other cryptocurrencies are either unnecessary or harmful to the ecosystem.

Cryptocurrency.name: Altcoin Support
Cryptocurrency.description: A diverse ecosystem of cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin is necessary for innovation and to address different use cases within blockchain technology.

Cryptocurrency.name: Proof of Work (PoW)
Cryptocurrency.description: Consensus should be achieved through miners solving complex mathematical puzzles, ensuring security through computational power.

Cryptocurrency.name: Proof of Stake (PoS)
Cryptocurrency.description: Consensus should be achieved by validators who hold and 'stake' cryptocurrency, with security ensured by economic incentives rather than computation.

Cryptocurrency.name: Proof of Authority (PoA)
Cryptocurrency.description: A small group of trusted authorities should validate transactions, as this reduces energy consumption and improves efficiency compared to PoW.

Cryptocurrency.name: Decentralization
Cryptocurrency.description: Cryptocurrencies and blockchain networks should remain fully decentralized, with no single point of control, to preserve user sovereignty and security.

Cryptocurrency.name: Centralized Control
Cryptocurrency.description: Cryptocurrencies should be subject to some level of centralized control or regulation to ensure stability, security, and wider adoption.

Cryptocurrency.name: Private Blockchains
Cryptocurrency.description: Enterprises and organizations should use private or permissioned blockchains for efficiency and control, rather than relying on fully public blockchains.

Cryptocurrency.name: Public Blockchains
Cryptocurrency.description: Public blockchains that are open and accessible to anyone are essential for transparency and true decentralization.

Cryptocurrency.name: Smart Contracts
Cryptocurrency.description: Self-executing contracts with code running on blockchain platforms like Ethereum should be widely adopted to automate and enforce agreements without intermediaries.

Cryptocurrency.name: Tokenization of Assets
Cryptocurrency.description: Real-world assets should be represented as digital tokens on blockchain networks to enable more efficient trading, ownership, and management.

Cryptocurrency.name: Decentralized Finance (DeFi)
Cryptocurrency.description: Financial services like lending, borrowing, and trading should be decentralized using blockchain technology, removing the need for traditional financial intermediaries.

Cryptocurrency.name: Layer 2 Solutions
Cryptocurrency.description: Scalability issues on blockchains should be addressed with Layer 2 solutions that handle transactions off-chain while maintaining the security of the base layer.

Cryptocurrency.name: Energy Efficiency in Blockchain
Cryptocurrency.description: Blockchain networks should prioritize energy-efficient consensus mechanisms to minimize their environmental impact.

Cryptocurrency.name: Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)
Cryptocurrency.description: Digital ownership of unique assets, such as art or collectibles, can be tokenized and verified on blockchain through NFTs, creating new markets for digital goods.

Cryptocurrency.name: Forking Blockchains
Cryptocurrency.description: Forking a blockchain to create new versions or competing networks is a valid way to resolve disagreements within the community and allow for innovation.

Cryptocurrency.name: Governance Tokens
Cryptocurrency.description: Cryptocurrency networks should use governance tokens that allow token holders to vote on changes and decisions within the network.

Cryptocurrency.name: Blockchain Interoperability
Cryptocurrency.description: Different blockchain networks should be designed to work together, allowing for the seamless transfer of assets and information between them.

Cryptocurrency.name: MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) as an Inevitable Cost
Cryptocurrency.description: MEV is an unavoidable byproduct of blockchain systems, and efforts should focus on minimizing its impact rather than eliminating it entirely.

Cryptocurrency.name: Eliminating MEV
Cryptocurrency.description: Blockchain designs should prioritize eliminating MEV entirely, as it incentivizes harmful behaviors like frontrunning and manipulation by validators.

Cryptocurrency.name: Redistributing MEV
Cryptocurrency.description: MEV should be redistributed to all network participants, ensuring that no single group benefits disproportionately from its extraction.

Cryptocurrency.name: Auction-Based MEV Extraction
Cryptocurrency.description: MEV extraction should be managed through transparent auctions, where the value extracted is bid on, rather than letting validators exploit it arbitrarily.

Cryptocurrency.name: Fully-Pegged Stablecoins
Cryptocurrency.description: Stablecoins, which are pegged to a stable asset like the US dollar, should be adopted for day-to-day transactions to avoid the volatility of traditional cryptocurrencies.

Cryptocurrency.name: Fully Algorithmic Stablecoins
Cryptocurrency.description: Algorithmic stablecoins, which use algorithms to adjust supply to maintain a stable value, are a promising solution to create decentralized, stable currencies.

Cryptocurrency.name: Hybrid Stablecoins
Cryptocurrency.description: Algorithmic stablecoins should combine both algorithmic mechanisms and collateralized assets to improve their stability and reduce the risk of failure.

Criminal Justice.name: Rehabilitative Justice
Criminal Justice.description: The focus of the criminal justice system should be on rehabilitating offenders and reintegrating them into society rather than punitive measures.

Criminal Justice.name: Retributive Justice
Criminal Justice.description: Criminals should face punishments proportional to their crimes, with the justice system focused on deterrence and retribution.

Criminal Justice.name: Restorative Justice
Criminal Justice.description: The criminal justice system should emphasize repairing harm caused by crime, involving victims and offenders in the resolution process.

Criminal Justice.name: Death Penalty
Criminal Justice.description: The death penalty is a necessary form of justice for the most serious crimes, serving as a deterrent and form of retribution.

Criminal Justice.name: Decriminalization of Non-Violent Offenses
Criminal Justice.description: Non-violent offenses, such as drug possession, should be decriminalized to reduce prison populations and focus on more serious crimes.

Criminal Justice.name: Zero Tolerance Policies
Criminal Justice.description: Strict, uncompromising punishment should be applied for all crimes, ensuring consistency and deterrence across the justice system.

Criminal Justice.name: Police Reform
Criminal Justice.description: Policing practices should be reformed to reduce systemic abuses, increase accountability, and better serve communities.

Criminal Justice.name: Prison Abolition
Criminal Justice.description: The prison system should be dismantled and replaced with alternative forms of justice that do not rely on incarceration.

Criminal Justice.name: Community Policing
Criminal Justice.description: Law enforcement should focus on building relationships with communities to prevent crime and increase trust between the police and citizens.

Criminal Justice.name: Three Strikes Laws
Criminal Justice.description: Criminals who commit three serious offenses should receive life sentences, regardless of the nature of the third crime, to protect society from repeat offenders.

Criminal Justice.name: Restitution to Victims
Criminal Justice.description: Offenders should be required to compensate victims for the harm caused by their crimes, with a focus on financial and emotional restitution.

Criminal Justice.name: Mandatory Minimum Sentencing
Criminal Justice.description: Judges should impose mandatory minimum sentences for certain crimes to ensure consistent punishments across cases.

Criminal Justice.name: Prison Reform
Criminal Justice.description: Prisons should be reformed to provide humane living conditions, access to education, and rehabilitation programs for inmates.

A Different Future.name: Effective Accelerationism
A Different Future.description: Technological and social acceleration should be deliberately guided to create more equitable outcomes and avoid societal collapse.

A Different Future.name: Accelerationism
A Different Future.description: The acceleration of capitalist and technological processes will inevitably lead to radical societal transformation, for better or worse.

A Different Future.name: Neoreaction (NRx)
A Different Future.description: Democracy and egalitarianism should be replaced with hierarchical, authoritarian governance, rejecting the principles of modern liberalism.

A Different Future.name: Post-Scarcity
A Different Future.description: With the advancement of technology, society should move toward a state where resources are abundant, and the need for money or work diminishes.

A Different Future.name: Techno-Feudalism
A Different Future.description: Technological advances are leading to a new form of feudalism, where power and wealth are concentrated in the hands of tech elites.

A Different Future.name: Anarcho-Capitalism
A Different Future.description: A stateless society should operate entirely through free markets and private property, with no government intervention.

A Different Future.name: Anarcho-Primitivism
A Different Future.description: Modern technology and industrialization have caused environmental destruction and social alienation, and society should return to a simpler, pre-industrial way of life.

A Different Future.name: Geoengineering
A Different Future.description: Humanity should actively manipulate the Earth's climate system through technologies like solar radiation management and carbon capture to combat climate change.

A Different Future.name: Antinatalism
A Different Future.description: Bringing new life into the world is morally wrong due to the inherent suffering in human existence, and people should refrain from having children.

A Different Future.name: Dark Enlightenment
A Different Future.description: Modern egalitarian values and democracy are flawed, and society should return to hierarchical structures led by elites.

A Different Future.name: Cybernetic Governance
A Different Future.description: Society should be governed by AI and algorithms, replacing human decision-makers with data-driven, automated systems.

A Different Future.name: Post-Politics
A Different Future.description: Traditional political ideologies are becoming obsolete in the face of technological advancement, and governance should transcend old political divisions.

A Different Future.name: Neoluddism
A Different Future.description: Modern technology should be rejected, and society should return to simpler, pre-industrial ways of life to preserve the environment and human well-being.

A Different Future.name: Paleolibertarianism
A Different Future.description: Personal freedom in economic matters should be combined with socially conservative values, promoting a free market but traditional morality.

A Different Future.name: Techno-Optimism
A Different Future.description: Rapid technological progress will lead to significant improvements in human life, and should be embraced and accelerated.

A Different Future.name: Cathedral vs. Bazaar
A Different Future.description: Top-down, centralized control (Cathedral) should be replaced by decentralized, bottom-up innovation (Bazaar) in society and technology.

A Different Future.name: Platform Feudalism
A Different Future.description: Modern digital platforms act as feudal lords, controlling their ecosystems and users in a hierarchical structure akin to feudalism.

A Different Future.name: Agorism
A Different Future.description: Individuals should engage in counter-economic activity by creating black or gray markets to bypass government regulations.

A Different Future.name: Libertarian Paternalism
A Different Future.description: Governments and institutions should guide people's decisions toward better outcomes through subtle 'nudges' while preserving freedom of choice.

A Different Future.name: Posthumanism
A Different Future.description: Humans should transcend their biological limitations through technology, merging with machines or evolving into new forms of life.

A Different Future.name: Left Accelerationism
A Different Future.description: The acceleration of capitalist technologies should be harnessed to collapse capitalism and create post-capitalist social structures.

A Different Future.name: Corporate Sovereignty
A Different Future.description: Large corporations will increasingly act as sovereign entities, taking on roles traditionally filled by governments in shaping law, policy, and society.

A Different Future.name: Post-Democracy
A Different Future.description: Democracy is being replaced by elite-driven decision-making processes, and the average citizen's influence on governance is diminishing.

A Different Future.name: Seasteading
A Different Future.description: New autonomous societies, often through seasteading or floating cities, offer a way to escape the constraints of traditional nation-states.

A Different Future.name: Globalist Technocracy
A Different Future.description: Global governance should be led by technical experts who use data-driven approaches to solve complex global problems.

A Different Future.name: Zerocracy
A Different Future.description: Future societies should be governed without human leadership, relying entirely on algorithms and decentralized systems to maintain order.
